thread.title: Republican Congressman Calls For Nunes To Recuse Himself From Russia Investigation
thread.title_full: Republican Congressman Calls For Nunes To Recuse Himself From Russia Investigation

author: Randy DeSoto
title: Republican Congressman Calls For Nunes To Recuse Himself From Russia Investigation
text:
Republican Congressman Calls For Nunes To Recuse Himself From Russia Investigation “I’m sure the Democrats do want me to quit ..." by Randy DeSoto March 28, 2017 at 4:01pm Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
Rep. Walter Jones, R-N.C., became the first Republican to call for House Intelligence Committee Chairman Devin Nunes to recuse himself from the investigation into Russia’s attempts to influence the presidential election. 
Jones is a member of the Armed Services Committee, but does not serve on the Intelligence Committee. 
“How can you be chairman of a major committee and do all these things behind the scenes and keep your credibility? You can’t keep your credibility,” Jones told The Hill . Advertisement - story continues below Trump Helps ‘Fox & Friends’ Promote Story On Podesta-Russia Connection 
“If anything has shown that we need a commission, this has done it by the way he has acted,” Jones added. “That’s the only way you can bring integrity to the process. The integrity of the committee looking into this has been tainted.” 
When asked on Tuesday by reporters whether he would recuse himself, Nunes replied , “Why would I not [continue to lead the investigation]?” he said. Republican joins calls for Devin Nunes to recuse himself from Russia probe: https://t.co/dX2EUP2BRP 
— The Washington Times (@WashTimes) March 28, 2017 Advertisement - story continues below 
House Speaker Paul Ryan indicated on Tuesday that Nunes still enjoys his full support in conducting the investigation. 
“I don’t care what Mr. Ryan says,” Jones said. “That’s his right to feel that way. I know how the people out here feel.” 
“When you have a committee chairman that bypasses the committee and goes to the White House, when you have a president that has a cloud over their head, that’s not smart,” Jones said. 
Appearing on The O’Reilly Factor Monday night, Nunes said the classified documents he saw relating to federal government officials surveilling communications involving the Trump transition team had “nothing to do with Russia.” Advertisement - story continues below
